original_solution_mapping.L1: First Jamie wants to figure out how many calories his father needs to lose from 5 pounds x 3500 calories each = <<5*3500=17500>>17,500 calories to burn off.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Then Jamie needs to figure out how many calories his father will burn per day if he burns 2500 calories - eating 2000 calories = burning <<2500-2000=500>>500 calories a day.
original_solution_mapping.L3: If Jamie's father wants to burn off 17,500 calories total at 500 calories a day, 17,500 / 500 = <<17500/500=35>>35 days to burn off 5 pounds.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4935.
    Returns: the number of days it will take for Jamie's father to burn off 5 pounds.
    """
    # L1
    pounds_to_lose = 5 # 5 pounds
    calories_per_pound = 3500 # 3,500 calories in a pound of body fat
    total_calories_to_burn = pounds_to_lose * calories_per_pound

    # L2
    calories_burned_daily = 2500 # burns 2,500 calories of fat a day
    calories_eaten_daily = 2000 # eating 2000 calories a day
    net_calories_burned_per_day = calories_burned_daily - calories_eaten_daily

    # L3
    days_to_burn_off_fat = total_calories_to_burn / net_calories_burned_per_day

    # FA
    answer = days_to_burn_off_fat
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: First Jamie wants to figure out how many calories his father needs to lose from {pounds_to_lose} pounds x {calories_per_pound} calories each = <<{pounds_to_lose}*{calories_per_pound}={total_calories_to_burn}>>{total_calories_to_burn} calories to burn off.

Then Jamie needs to figure out how many calories his father will burn per day if he burns {calories_burned_daily} calories - eating {calories_eaten_daily} calories = burning <<{calories_burned_daily}-{calories_eaten_daily}={net_calories_burned_per_day}>>{net_calories_burned_per_day} calories a day.

If Jamie's father wants to burn off {total_calories_to_burn} calories total at {net_calories_burned_per_day} calories a day, {total_calories_to_burn} / {net_calories_burned_per_day} = <<{total_calories_to_burn}/{net_calories_burned_per_day}={days_to_burn_off_fat}>>{days_to_burn_off_fat} days to burn off 5 pounds.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: First Jamie wants to figure out how many calories his father needs to lose from 5 pounds x 3500 calories each = <<5*3500=17500>>17500 calories to burn off.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Then Jamie needs to figure out how many calories his father will burn per day if he burns 2500 calories - eating 2000 calories = burning <<2500-2000=500>>500 calories a day.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If Jamie's father wants to burn off 3500 calories total at 500 calories a day, 3500 / 500 = <<3500/500=7>>7 days to burn off 5 pounds.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'calories_per_pound' (value: 3500) was used instead of 'total_calories_to_burn' (value: 17500).
